properties.name: Chez Panisse
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulack  1517 Shattuck Avenue, Berkeley, CA, 94709that unbelievable stop between time and space. one moment.

properties.name: LAX
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulackyou were leaving for tokyo. you told me stories about japan and about candy that looked like fruit and flowers.

properties.name: amsterdam
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulackyou left yesterday to fly to amsterdam with my best friend. you called me before you left, but i didn\'t pick up because i was in a meeting. you left a message and told me you loved me.

properties.name: beach
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulack323 Ocean Front Walk venice cawe walked down the beach. we found the perfect woman to give me a henna tatoo on my foot. we watched each other

properties.name: berkeley marina
properties.description: Posted by Lannybudd160 University Avenue, Berkeley, CA, 94710Sylvia and i went for a long walk here one morning in march. the sun was shining. we discovered our love that day.

properties.name: paris france
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulack

properties.name: that big fight
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulackbakersfield californiayou got mad at me and stopped the car. i grabbed the keys and threw them across the street. it was dark.

properties.name: the first time i really saw sylvia
properties.description: Posted by Lannybudd100 second avenue new york nywe had known each other through mutual friends. sylvia came along with lily that night. she sat next to me at the indian restaurant. she tipped her head to the side and a bright light came on in my mind as i noticed her as if for the first time. it was magnetic.

properties.name: valentines day
properties.description: Posted by Sylviakulackpocatello idahowe were driving one of those "driveaway" cars across the country for a guy in new jersey who sold a screenplay about a maniac bear ("think Jaws but with a bear" he said when he handed us the keys). right outside of Pocatello, a tire blew. it was valentines day. we spent the afternoon walking from the garage to a strip mall down the road. you told me to wait outside and you went into a drug store and bought me a sappy hallmark valentines card. it was the sweetest thing, given that you are not into sappy. or hallmark. i kept that card for years but lost it in the fire. i think that was the last valentines day we were so innocent. remember?
